title: Stealthy Linux rootkit found in the wild after going undetected for 2 years
dot:
digraph Krasue_Rootkit{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];Krasue[label="Krasue
Linux Remote Access Trojan"];Target[label="Targets
Telecommunications in Thailand"];Infection[label="Infection Methods
- Exploiting Vulnerabilities
- Credential Theft
- Trojan in Software Updates"];Rootkits[label="Rootkit Features
- Hides processes, files, and directories
- Hooks `kill()` syscall
- Uses public open-source rootkits"];C2_Communication[label="C2 Communication
- UDP socket on port 52699
- AES-CBC encryption
- RTSP for alive ping"];Commands[label="C2 Commands
- ping: Reply with pong
- info: Get malware status
- shell: Run shell commands"];Hardcoded_IPs[label="Hardcoded IPs
- 9 internal addresses
- Connects to external only after failing"];Deployment[label="Deployment
- Later stages of attack
- Maintains access to victim host"];Research[label="Research by Group-IB
- Active for 2 years
- Documented in Dec 2023"]; Krasue->Target;Krasue->Infection;Krasue->Rootkits;Krasue->C2_Communication;C2_Communication->Commands;C2_Communication->Hardcoded_IPs;Krasue->Deployment;Krasue->Research;}
